text: The Aßberg is a 703-m high mountain located in the Thuringian Highland region of Thuringia, Germany. It is located close to the municipalities of Deesbach, Meura, Reichmannsdorf, and Schmiedefeld and the Leibis-Lichte Dam in the Saalfeld-Rudolstadt district in the Thuringian Forest Nature Park. {| class="wikitable" |+ Neighbouring mountains |- bgcolor="#EECFA1" align="center" || Description | Height above sea level | Direction | Particularity |- || Rehhecke | align="center"| 707.0 m |align="center"| N NW | Coniferous forest |- || Rauhhügel |align="center"|801.9 m |align="center"| S | Observation tower, radio mast |- || Mutzenberg | align="center"| 770.0 m |align="center"| SW | |- || Spitzer Berg | align="center"| 790.3 m |align="center"| W SW | Coniferous forest |- |} ==See also== * List of Mountains and Elevations of Thuringia Category:Mountains of Thuringia Category:Saalfeld-Rudolstadt
title: Aßberg (Thuringian Highland)
